page.title: 17Economics in Eccleshall
page.content: The economy of Eccleshall is that of a farming community with associated facilities. The Midland Bank and National Westminster Bank offer services in a helpful and friendly small branch atmosphere. Walters and Welch are the local solicitors and are agents for two building societies. There are four estate agents: Barber and Son, Owen Bennion, John German and Robert S. Heywood, all of whom are agents for different building societies, as is Trent Insurance. Eccleshall Post Office has National Savings Bank and National Girobank facilities and employs six full-time postmen of great character who deal cheerfully with the hazards of country roads and their attendant animals. Copmere End has a small post office with similar facilities.
